Two-headed trolls are savage, dual-minded monsters with an unquenchable thirst for bloodshed, and dread tales of their ravenous appetites are whispered of in homesteads throughout the lands of the Inner Sea. Indeed, it is a custom for parents to invoke the two-headed troll as a warning to misbehaving children. “Finish your chores,” a parent might say to a stubborn child, “or a two-headed troll will snatch you away at night and swallow you whole!” It's unclear why such a morbid tradition gained traction with parents, but it's an undeniable fact that two-headed trolls have an appetite for “nibbles”—creatures small enough to devour with one bite. Mature two-headed trolls stand 13 feet in height, weighing roughly 1,700 pounds. Unlike common trolls, two-headed trolls share the upright gait of their [ettin](/Monsters.aspx?ID=204) ancestry and do not walk hunched over. **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 24 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 21 [Two-Headed Troll](/Monsters.aspx?ID=833) **Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 266 2.0 **Perception** +18; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Jotun](/Languages.aspx?ID=8) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +18, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +17 **Str** +6 **Dex** +1 **Con** +6 **Int** -2 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +3 **Independent Brains** Each of a two-headed troll's heads rolls their own initiative and has their own turn. Neither head can [Delay](/Actions.aspx?ID=77). At the start of a head's turn, that head gets 2 actions and 1 reaction. Each brain controls one of the troll's arms, but both can move the legs. Any ability that would sever a two-headed troll's head (such as the [_vorpal_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=308) weapon property) doesn't cause the two-headed troll to die if they still have their other head, but does cause them to lose the turns, actions, and reactions of the severed head. [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106) effects that target a single creature affect only one of the troll's heads. **Items** [Club](/Weapons.aspx?ID=2) --- **AC** 24 **Fort** +20 **Ref** +15 **Will** +14 **HP** 190 , regeneration 25 (deactivated by acid or fire) **Weaknesses** fire 10 **Head Regrowth** A two-headed troll's regeneration can regrow a severed head. After regaining Hit Points from regeneration, the two-headed troll attempts a DC 10 flat check. On a success, the missing head is fully restored. If a two-headed troll loses their last remaining head, they die immediately.
**[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)** --- **Speed** 30 feet **Melee** jaws +18 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d12+8 piercing **Melee** claw +18 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d8+8 slashing **Melee** club +18 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d6+8 bludgeoning **Ranged** club +13 ([thrown 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)), **Damage** 2d6+8 bludgeoning **Reactive Chomp** **Trigger** On one head's initiative, the troll hits the same enemy with two consecutive claw Strikes in the same round; **Effect** While the prey is distracted with unrelenting claw attacks, the head that's not taking its turn makes a jaws Strike against the enemy.
Mother of Trolls Trolls and [ettins](/Monsters.aspx?ID=204) do not normally seek one another as mates, but this pairing is the source of the original two-headed trolls—such couplings were engineered and arranged by the cult of [Lamashtu](/Deities.aspx?ID=11) in ages past. Oblivious to their origin, two-headed trolls tend to give no deference to the Mother of Monsters.
name: Two-Headed Troll
